headline: Trump shares racist video depicting the Obamas as monkeys, leaving White House scrambling
description: After initially denouncing what it described as 'fake outrage' from the media, the presidential administration eventually blamed the post on President Donald Trump's Truth Social account on an unidentified staffer's mistake and deleted it.

headline: Epstein case put former minister Jack Lang under investigation and his Arab World Institute presidency at risk
2026 Olympics Figure Skating: Russia ban opens up team event like never before
The Netherlands learns a lesson on right and far-right alliances
description: Seven out of the 26 members of the parliamentary group of the Party for Freedom (PVV) defected on January 20, criticizing their leader for a lack of internal democracy. The far-right party, which was part of the governing coalition in 2024 and 2025, is now only the fourth-largest group in the Dutch House of Representatives.

headline: In Syria's Roj detention camp, jihadist women are convinced they will soon be 'freed'
description: The female prisoners, mostly foreign nationals who joined the Islamic State group in the 2010s, celebrate the advance of Syrian government forces, who are set to retake control of the camps and prisons in the Kurdish autonomous region under the January 30 agreement.

headline: Glitz, opera and alpine spectacle mark opening of Milan-Cortina Olympics
description: Athletes paraded across multiple Alpine venues as organizers launched the most geographically dispersed Games in Olympic history, while Lindsey Vonn's injury-defying comeback drew early attention. Celebrations in Milan unfolded alongside protests over the presence of US immigration agents supporting the American delegation.

headline: Julian Barnes bids farewell: 'There's no such thing as a perfect novel'
description: The British writer has published what he says will be his final book, 'Departure(s)', as he celebrates his 80th birthday. He welcomed Le Monde into his home in London for a wide-ranging conversation on his career as a writer and his body of work.

headline: Danone recalls batches of infant formula in Britain, Spain, Croatia and Slovenia over potential toxin
Islamic State claims responsibility for attack on Shiite mosque that killed at least 31 in Pakistan
Iran anticipates more negotiations with the US, citing a 'positive atmosphere' during talks in Oman
Director of France's Museum of Immigration History: 'Fraternity has played a much greater role in our history than surges of xenophobia'
2026 Winter Olympics open amid geopolitical and climate tensions
Iranian photojournalist shares unseen images of Tehran protests
Norway crown princess 'deeply regrets' Epstein friendship
French government expects resistance from Jack Lang after summons to explain Epstein ties
France warns of possible 'IS resurgence' in Syria, where 'French citizens' security is also at stake'
Three years after an earthquake killed 54,000 people in Turkey, legal proceedings stall
France detects Russia-linked Epstein smear attempt against Macron, says government source
EU tells TikTok to change its 'addictive' design or face fines
'Canada, better the 28th EU member than the 51st US state'
description: The Canadian prime minister has called for an alliance of middle powers to stand up to the world's great powers. This is a compelling idea, and one that Europe has been pursuing for 60 years, writes Le Monde columnist Pascal Riché.

headline: This French territory off the coast of Canada has 'no clear sense of worry' over Trump
description: Elected representatives in Saint-Pierre-et-Miquelon, the only French overseas territory in the North Atlantic, home to 6,000 people, aim to deepen ties with their major partner, Canada, amid growing geopolitical tensions with the US.

headline: Bad Bunny, the anti-Trump icon made in Puerto Rico
description: On Sunday, in front of tens of millions of television viewers, the Puerto Rican reggaeton phenomenon will headline the Super Bowl halftime show, on the heels of winning Album of the Year at the Grammys. But, at a time when the ruthless crackdown on undocumented immigrants is raging in the US, inviting this Latin icon to one of America's major events was always bound to anger Donald Trump.

headline: Epstein scandal tarnishes former minister Jack Lang and France's image
'Trump put liberal democracy in the crosshairs in 2025, he might pull the trigger in 2026'
'In the US, Christian nationalism contributes to the dismantling of democracy'
